intro: Parrya turkestanica, commonly known as the Turkestan parrya, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to Central Asia, particularly found in regions of Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, and Tajikistan. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and compound leaves, which are often finely divided. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are typically arranged in umbels, a common feature in the carrot family. Parrya turkestanica is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils.
